title: Rafael Nadal and Mery Perelló wedding: Dress seen for the first time
text:
Fans have been given the first look at the stunning bespoke gown worn by Mery Perelló for her wedding to tennis ace Rafael Nadal over the weekend.

Mery, 31, donned a breathtaking long-sleeved dress by Spanish designer Rosa Clara to tie the knot with her sports star beau, 33, at the British-owned La Fortaleza - Spain's most expensive property - on Mallorca on Saturday.

The couple shared two stunning snaps from the lavish nuptials online yesterday, including the first full-length photo of Mery's demure wedding dress.

The loved-up newlyweds are seen standing with their arms wrapped around each other as they posed for photos at the stunning Spanish fort.

Writing on her blog, Rosa Clara revealed the bride was heavily involved in creating the dress - which featured Art Deco-inspired lace and a bejewelled neckline - as well as a second, slinkier gown worn to the evening reception.

Breathtaking: Fans have been given the first look at the stunning wedding dress worn by Mery Perelló as she tied the knot with tennis ace Rafael Nadal over the weekend, pictured

Radiant: Mery, 31, donned a breathtaking long-sleeved gown by Spanish designer Rosa Clara for the ceremony at the British-owned La Fortaleza - Spain's most expensive property - on the island of Mallorca on Saturday. The wedding dress designer shared this photo of the dress

Loved-up: Rafael was snapped brushing hair behind Mery's ear as the couple shared an intimate moment on their wedding day. The pair tied the knot in front of 350 guests

Rafael Nadal married Mery, his partner of 14 years, in front of 350 guests at the beautiful 17th century property, which overlooks the bay of Pollensa in north-east Mallorca.

The former fort has featured in several big-budget film and television dramas - including the critically-acclaimed Night Manager - and is now one of the country's most sought-after wedding venues.

Mery's demure gown featured a bodice with a jewel-embellihed neckline and long sleeves and was made of beautiful Art Deco-inspired French lace.

The ballgown-style skirt, made of silk crepe, featured a weightless detachable train. Mery completed her bridal look with a wonderfully subtle silk tulle veil.

The designer also revealed she designed a second, slinkier, bespoke gown for the Mery to wear to the evening party, as well as dresses for the bride's mother and Rafael's mother and sister.

Slinky: Sketches of the second dress reveal Mery plumped for a figure-hugging, backless halterneck design (pictured) to party the night away at the evening reception

Demure: Mery's first demure gown featured a bodice with a jewel-embellished neckline and long sleeves and was made of beautiful Art Deco-inspired French lace, pictured

Rosa Clara described the second dress as 'subtly alluring' with scalloped flower motifs and a 'sophisticated dropped back hem'.

It is thought Mery swept her brunette locks up into a low updo to accentuate the dramatic back of the dress for the evening reception.

The bride-to-be was involved in designing both gowns, making several visits to the designer's Barcelona boutique.

Picture-perfect wedding: After the ceremony, Rafael chatted to the priest Tomeu Catala while a bridesmaid held Mery's long billowing veil

Rosa also revealed she had dressed Mery's mother, María Pascual, as well as Rafael's mother, Ana María Parera, and sister, Maribel Nadal, in designs from her cocktail collection.

In a statement shared online, Rosa said: 'I feel very fortunate to have met Mery and to have designed the wedding dress she had always dreamt of.

'Being part of this moment is thrilling and a little scary — the responsibility that comes with a wedding like this that receives so much international attention is enormous.

Gorgeous: Nadal's sister Maria Isabel looked beautiful in a red figure-hugging gown, which featured intricate beading at the neckline

Proud sister: Maria looked over the moon to watch Rafael and Mery tie the knot and smiled as she chatted to fellow guests

Having fun: The couple's professional photographer took some photos of the wedding party, who posed against the picturesque backdrop

Mesmerized: The wedding party appeared enchanted by the castle, which boasts stunning views of the north west coast of the island

'The connection with Mery was immediate, as it was with her mother and Rafa’s mother and sister. They’re an extraordinary family and it has been a pleasure to work with them.'

The newlyweds were spotted sharing a special moment during the nuptials, with Rafael tenderly caressing Mery's face as they stood under a giant archway adorned with eucalyptus, fern and wild flowers.

Rafael looked dapper in a navy tailored suit and white shirt, while Mery - also known as Xisca - is believed to have worn a stunning long-sleeved gown designed by internationally acclaimed bridal wear designer Rosa Clará.

Idyllic: The hugely popular wedding venue owned by Conservative party donor Lord Lupton - is where footballer Gareth Bale tied the knot earlier this year

Breathtaking venue: Several smartly-dressed guests looked out at the view after arriving for the wedding

'Going to marry two people who love each other': The priest that married Rafa and Mery, named Tomeu Catala, sipped on some water following the ceremony as he gazed out at the idyllic surrounding countryside

Laughter and sunshine: The wedding party later gathered in the gardens of the castle, where they were served canapes

Delicious cuisine: Rafa roped in popular Majorcan chef Macarena de Castro, who whetted the appetite of the star-studded crowd at the reception

She wore her brunette locks in soft curls and decided upon a classic veil to match her elegant bridal gown.

After the ceremony, Rafael chatted to priest Tomeu Catala, while a bridesmaid held Mery's long billowing veil.

Nadal's sister Maria Isabel, meanwhile, looked beautiful in a red figure-hugging gown which featured intricate beading at the neckline.

Maria looked over the moon to watch Rafael and Mery tie the knot and smiled as she chatted to fellow guests.

Historic site: Proving to be quite a highly sought out A-list destination, La Fortaleza is also where the acclaimed BBC thriller The Night Manager, starring Tom Hiddleston, Hugh Laurie and Olivia Colman, was filmed

Star-studded affair: Juan Carlos I, the king of Spain from 1975 to 2014, was believed to be among those in attendance while the Michelin-star chef, Quique Dacosta, was reportedly in charge of catering

Looking good! Wedding guests were certainly dressed to the nines for the star-studded wedding

Family guy: Nadal has made no secret of his desire to have children, saying he is a 'family guy' and is looking forward to having his own brood in the not too distant future

The wedding party appeared enchanted by the castle, with many posing for photos against the stunning backdrop of the north west coast of the island.

Elsewhere, also making a sharp arrival was tennis player Feliciano López, who put on a dapper display in a slick three-piece navy suit as he was joined by his stunning other half, Sandra Gago.

Former Argentinian tennis player Juan Monaco and his girlfriend Diana Arnopoulos cut a stylish figure as they left a hotel in Pollenca to make their way to the nuptials.

Preparations: The venue owned by Conservative party donor Lord Lupton - which is where footballer Gareth Bale tied the knot earlier this year - also saw a marquee go up on Thursday (Stock image of venue)

History: The original fort, which is now Spain's most expensive property, was built in 1628 to defend Majorca against invaders. Stock image of venue

Overhaul: Ahead of Lupton's purchase, the estate has been transformed and expanded to include seven villas complete with 17 en-suite bedrooms, two swimming pools and a helipad

Diana looked incredible in a flowing in a printed brown and black dress and dangling double gold hoop earrings.

Rafa has also roped in popular Majorcan chef Macarena de Castro, who will be whetting the appetite of the star-studded crowd at the reception.

Priest Tomeu Catala spoke to the island paper Diario de Mallorca earlier this month. He gushed: 'Everyone of the weddings I have been involved in has been special and this one will be the same. I am just going to marry two people who love each other.'
description: Fans have been given the first look at the stunning wedding dress worn by Mery Perelló as she tied the knot with tennis ace Rafael Nadal in a lavish Mallorcan ceremony on Saturday.
